Function Documentation

void check_arg_nums ( unsigned int  num_args  ) 

Checks if the current number of args on the stack is greater or less than num_args, and throws the corresponding error if so.

void check_can_be_evaluated ( ESI  expression,
ESI  var 
)

Throws an error if the expression contains any variables other than var.

ESI get_expr ( ESI *  arg_ptr  ) 

Simply returns another pointer to arg_ptr, and then makes arg_ptr point to the next expression

float get_float ( ESI *  ptr  ) 

Converts any expression pointed to by ptr to a float, makes ptr point to the next expression, and returns the float. Will throw ER_ARGUMENT if ptr cannot be simplified to a float. Will add a bcd of the float to the top of the stack.

unsigned int get_int ( ESI *  ptr  ) 

Converts any expression pointed to by ptr to a positive int, makes ptr point to the next expression, and returns the int. Will throw ER_ARGUMENT if ptr cannot be simplified to an int, however, it will convert if it is negative or decimal, it will simply round or take the absolute value. Will add a bcd of the float to the top of the stack.

ESI get_var_expr ( ESI *  arg_ptr  ) 

Returns the expression, and makes arg_ptr point to the next expression on the stack. If the expression originally pointed to is not a variable, it will throw an error.
